definition: to be reborn/to regenerate/to be a second so-and-so (famous dead person)/recycling/regeneration
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
like a second parent (idiom); one's great benefactor

pinyin: bu4 ke3 zai4 sheng1 zi1 yuan2
zai4 sheng1 bu4 liang2 xing4 pin2 xue4

definition: to expand production/to reproduce on an extended scale

sentences.english: For this reason regenerators are not found in aircraft engines.
sentences.chinese: 在飛機發動機中沒有采用再生器。

sentences.english: Landscape irrigation is an important aspect of reclaimed wastewater reuse.
sentences.chinese: 灌溉綠地是再生水回用的重要途徑之一。

sentences.english: Regenerate current harness and redisplay cables.
sentences.chinese: 再生當前線束並重新顯示纜。

sentences.english: The lining structure at the linked position between inclined pipe and regenerator was improved.
sentences.chinese: 對斜管與再生器相貫線部位的襯裏結構進行了改進。

sentences.english: The cure of congenital aplastic anemia and general again block is same.
sentences.chinese: 先天性再生障礙性貧血的治療與一般再障相同。

sentences.english: If we recover the waste materials through grading recovery, we can create these renewable resources.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們開展分級回收，就能夠創造這些再生資源。

sentences.english: Their design is described in the Journal of Renewable and Sustainable Energy. [Bharat Raj Singh and Onkar Singh, http://bit.ly/bFd3dO]
sentences.chinese: 他們的這項設計發表在《可再生與可持續能源》上。

sentences.english: Swtich to renewable sources of energy.
Bone of the father, unknowingly given, you will renew your son.
sentences.chinese: 父親的骨，無意中捐出，可使你的兒子再生。

sentences.english: Organovo calls itself a regenerative medicine company.
Slagging capacity of regenerator has direct influences on the quality of circulating wash oil and consumption of wash oil.
sentences.chinese: 再生器造渣能力直接關係到循環洗油質量和洗油消耗。

sentences.english: KBP may promote regeneration of optic nerve axon after injury.
sentences.chinese: KBP在視神經損傷後可能促進了視神經的軸突再生。

sentences.english: Huiquan Li, Jinshu Wang. Recycling and Reuse of Ionic Liquid in Homogeneous Cellulose Acetylation.
sentences.chinese: 蔗渣纖維素在離子液體中的溶解與再生。

sentences.english: A regeneration system of plantlets was established with apical bud of Acer negundo L.
sentences.chinese: 初步建立了複葉槭頂芽組培再生體系。

sentences.english: Regenerative and reparative body oil that helps tissue elasticity, treating and preventing the appearance of stretch marks.
sentences.chinese: 再生和修復身體組織彈性，治療和預防妊娠紋的出現。

sentences.english: This is an important way to make the Renewable Energy Law to realize its ideal value.
sentences.chinese: 這是保證《可再生能源法》發揮理想價值的重要路徑。

definition: to restore/to renovate/restoration/(computing) to fix (a bug)
to give a new lease of life/to reconstruct/to reform/to rework/to recycle/to reproduce (copies, or offspring)/restoration/restructuring
to restore (sth) to (its) former condition/to recover from illness/recovery
to be reborn/to recover/to come back to life/to regenerate
the body/organism (usually human)/(fig.) fabric (of society etc)/cohesive structure (of an entity)
to age/to deteriorate with age/old and weak
to bear/to give birth/to grow/to rear/to bring up (children)/fertility
